result.execSummary:
The defendant April N Kincaid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 7 days were granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: Case 15CF631
May be tranferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.

No contact with any TJ Max stores in the State of Wisconsin.
Must not commit any retail theft.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April N Kincaid

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant April N Kincaid in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Count #1. Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Crawford makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

45 Days Jail with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 7 days if revoked).  STAYED. Concurrent to Case #15CF631.

Term of Probation: 1 Year (Can be transferred to Milwaukee County)

Conditions of Probation:

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
-No contact with any TJ Max stores in the state of Wisconsin.

-Must not commit any retail theft.	

Condition Time: 5 days Jail. STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation ($250.00 Cash Bail to be applied.)
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
